# Question

Given a DataFrame `df` with column `dt` representing DateTimes. Write a function `add_yearmonth` that creates a new column `ym` by extracting year and month from `dt` and concatenating them together as an integer in format: “yyyymm”.

Here is the required code snippet:
```julia
using DataFrames, Dates

function add_yearmonth(df::DataFrame)
    df[:ym] = map(d -> DateFormat.format("yyyyMM")(d), df[:dt]) |> Vector{String}
end
```
This function takes a DataFrame and adds a new column `ym` to it, which is the year and month of each date in format "yyyymm". The map function applies the anonymous function (denoted by `->`) to every element in the `dt` column. This anonymous function uses the built-in DateFormat.format("yyyyMM") function to convert the DateTime to a string in the desired format.
